issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I *think* in 3.4.x we had the display time set to mirror the user's local browser time, but even if in 4.0 it is supposed to be displaying the time where the cloud is, this time is way off. 

I just created a snap at 10:08 AM CDT, and the creation time shown is 15:08:52 PM today, which is in the future. 

We have invented a time travel machine! Yay!

Screenshot attached. 

Affected pages:
- Instance detail page
- Volume detail page
- Snapshot detail page
- Launch configuration landing page and detail page
- IAM User detail page
- IAM Group detail page
fields.summary: Timestamp on resource detail pages is nowhere near the time I am, and makes no sense

comments.body:
I know when I'm setting password expiration with euare commands, I have to use UTC. That's true for the timestamp on the API requests as well. Not sure about creation times. Need to check the API. I don't recall adjusting those for browser timezone in old versions. 

from the API docs, it shows a time format (in this case, for SnapshotCreation) of <startTime>YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.SSSZ</startTime>
The "Z" at the end represents "Zulu" or UTC. (Zulu was something pilots used). wikipedia shows this (FYI):
If the time is in UTC, add a Z directly after the time without a space. Z is the zone designator for the zero UTC offset. "09:30 UTC" is therefore represented as "09:30Z" or "0930Z". "14:45:15 UTC" would be "14:45:15Z" or "144515Z".

UTC time is also known as 'Zulu' time, since 'Zulu' is the NATO phonetic alphabet word for 'Z'.
[~jloza]: Offering local timezone support is a fairly significant effort and should be marked as a story or improvement for 4.1 IMO.
Yeah, I thought this was a regression...
[~jloza]: Is this an issue only on the snapshot detail page, or is it on the landing page as well?
This appears to be displaying correctly on the snap landing page.

[~jloza]: Ok, good to know.  Angular's date filter converts the timestamps to the browser's local time, so we'll need to do the same for the detail pages (which don't use the date filter).  Not sure if we should mark this as a regression if it works on the landing page.
Yep, still a regression, since in 3.4.x we showed this correctly in expandos (which the detail area replaced). We should fix this for all detail pages.
[~jloza]: Ok, could you update the title of this ticket to refer to all detail pages that have a timestamp?
[~jloza]: Could you list the detail pages where we are seeing this issue to properly scope this ticket?

[~kgill] It might be faster for you to just look at the code for the detail pages and see which are missing the piece that does the change to the local time, than it would be for me (or you, for that matter) to use the console to create all the resources and look, what do you think? I am hoping that since the landing pages (at least the snap landing does) convert the time properly you can see what is doing that and will know what to look for?
[~jloza]: Ok, I'll review the code and will add the list of affected detail pages to the description.

verified on all pages listed in the issue description that the time displayed is my local time. 

Verified on mac osx 10.9.2, FF 29
